description: Pascal's triangle (excluding first, last three elements of each row) read by rows, row n read mod n.
comments: Prime numbered rows contain all zeros.
links: T. D. Noe, Rows n=6..100 of triangle, flattened
mathematica: Table[Mod[Binomial[n, k], n], {n, 6, 20}, {k, 3, n-3}] // Flatten (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Jan 17 2014 *)
prog: (Haskell)a053203 n k = a053203_tabl !! (n - 6) !! ka053203_row n = a053203_tabl !! (n - 6)a053203_tabl = zipWith (\k row -> take (k - 5) $ drop 3 row)                       [6..] $ drop 6 a053200_tabl-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 24 2014
crossrefs: Row sums give A053206. Cf. A053200, A053201, A053203, A007318 (Pascal's triangle)
author: Asher Auel (asher.auel(AT)reed.edu) Dec 12, 1999
extensions: a(30) corrected by T. D. Noe, Feb 08 2008
